sen.j: 顕尊（けんそん、永禄7年1月22日 (旧暦)（1564年3月5日） - 文禄4年3月3日 (旧暦)（1595年4月12日））は、興正寺第17世門主。
sen.e: Kenson (March 5, 1564 - April 12, 1595) was the seventeenth head priest of Kosho-ji Temple.

sen.e: In 1569, he succeeded Kosho-ji Temple while he was an associated head priest of the temple.

sen.j: 石山戦争では、外部から父の籠る石山本願寺を支えて、安芸国の毛利輝元と図って兵糧を石山本願寺に運び入れる工作を行う。
sen.e: In the Ishiyama war, he managed to ferry supplies from outside into the besieged Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple to support his father who was holding the temple, in conspiracy with Terumoto MORI of Aki Province.

sen.j: 父が石山本願寺を退去するとこれに従い、紀伊国 鷺森本願寺・和泉国 貝塚市・摂津国 大坂 天満と移り住む。
sen.e: After his father retired from Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple, Kenson followed his father and migrated to various places such as Saginomori Hongan-ji in Kii Province, Kaizuka City in Izumi Province, and Ozaka Tenma in Settsu Province.

sen.j: その2年後に顕如が豊臣秀吉の斡旋で京都七条通に西本願寺を再興すると、その南隣に土地を与えられ興正寺を再建した。
sen.e: Two years later, when his father Kennyo restored Nishi Hongan-ji Temple at Shichijo-dori Street, Kyoto, through mediation of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, Kenson was given a land next to the Nishi Hongan-ji Temple, where he reconstructed Kosho-ji Temple.

sen.j: 父・顕如の死後の後継者争いでは、異母弟の准如を支援して自分の娘の阿古をその正室とした。
sen.e: In the race for successor of his father Kennyo, Kenson supported his younger half brother Junnyo, whom his daughter Ako married as a lawful wife.
